alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 12:50PM EDT until July 09 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of near 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area over the next 3 hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middletown, Port Jervis, Walden, Warwick, Goshen, Howells, Chester, Montgomery, Florida, Cuddebackville, Otisville, Huguenot, Unionville, Scotchtown, Deerpark, Orange Lake, Mechanicstown, Westtown, Maybrook and Slate Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
